To help with the future deployment of Entourage in your region, be our eyes and ears! Share with us what you observe in your environment.

This questionnaire covers various themes, so answer as many as you can. If the situation evolves, you can fill it in again to keep us informed.
Your collaboration is invaluable, and we thank you warmly!

Call on your neighbors to help surround a homeless person. <font color

Exchanges in groups must take place with respect, trust and mutual assistance between members so that everyone can feel safe and in a warm environment. It is therefore not permitted to make degrading, aggressive, insulting, discriminatory, insistent, intolerant or defamatory comments.
The groups are spaces for exchange and mutual aid between neighbors, advertising is therefore prohibited, as are proposals for purchase, sale or rental.
Generally speaking, there is no money relationship between the members of the groups, prize pools are prohibited.

Benevolent free expression is the rule on groups. However, to respect the apolitical and secular nature of Entourage and in the interest of protecting people, subjects relating to politics, religion, medical or sexuality are not authorized.

Publications cannot contain any personal data allowing a person to be precisely identified and located nor any sensitive data about people (medical, judicial, ethical origin, sexual or political orientation data, etc.).
I use the application for the purpose of mutual aid for people in very precarious or excluded situations.
I ensure the consent of the people concerned before creating an action.
I guarantee not to communicate sensitive personal data (medical, legal, etc.), or allowing the precise identification or location of people.
I undertake to make no distinction as to race, color, sex, language, religion, political opinion, property, birth or any other status.
The application enables neighbors to meet up and share ideas. Distance assistance (drive, delivery, gift voucher, kitty...) is not authorized.

I can ask for or offer material goods (equipment, clothing, etc.), services (laundry, printing of documents, etc.) and sharing times (coffee, activity, etc.). I cannot request or offer financial assistance, accommodation or food assistance. But if I need it, I can contact the moderator who will guide me.
When I post a request for a third party, I make sure to obtain their consent beforehand.
I undertake to enter into relationships with people without discrimination (race, religion, sexual orientation, political opinion, etc.).

I guarantee that my actions do not contain any personal data (last name, telephone number, precise address, etc.), allowing a person to be precisely identified and located, nor any sensitive data (medical, legal, etc.).
You accept that anyone participates in your event, without checking their profile first.
You validate each person individually before confirming that they can participate.
Your action is public, everyone can participate freely.
Your action is private, you will have the choice to accept or refuse any person requesting to participate.

Actions with a clear title attract more members and are more likely to succeed!
Your title must be less than 100 characters. You can say more in the description.
Example: Game evening between neighbors with and without homes
Events with a clear title attract more participants.
Example: I am a former town hall employee and available for administrative assistance in accessing housing.\nIf you think you need help, we can meet in a café on the weekend.
Tell your story. Actions with a clear description attract more members and are more likely to succeed!
Example: Need for volunteers for the national Restos du Cœur collection in our local team

resources.string: A neighbor offers new help. Maybe this might interest you?
A neighbor is looking for equipment. Maybe you could help him?
Our mission: to mobilize and equip citizens to support the most excluded.
Meet neighbors who are like you during \ events and discuss solidarity actions.
The teams of d\'ambassadors, volunteers and moderators d\'Entourage accompany you and guide you on a daily basis.
First of all d\…\nWhat is your name?
Only the first letter will be displayed
I agree to receive information and advice from Entourage
*Required fields. Your information will remain confidential and will never be communicated to third parties.

Entourage asks you these few questions to welcome you and support you as best as possible!\n
To help homeless people and create connections in your neighborhood.
To ask for help and discover places of solidarity.
To speak on behalf of your structure.
You will be able to respond to requests from people in difficulty and from associations in your neighborhood, and you yourself will be able to offer donations of your time or materials.
In which neighborhood do you usually live?
You will be able to ask your neighbors for help and meet new people during friendly network events.

With a photo, it\'s immediately nicer.\nShow us your warmest smile.
Entourage is an association serving your activities.

Concretely, in the app, features are dedicated to you

A verified profile for each of your members: a guarantee of trust for your neighbors
A page for your structure: to inform locally about your activities and needs.
Sending notifications in your neighborhood and beyond to community members.

At Entourage, the main goal is to foster friendly and lasting relationships. I commit to respecting this focus by avoiding any romantic or amorous approach or publication. Thus, I actively contribute to maintaining a warm and caring environment for everyone.

Example: I suggest a walk in the park this weekend to chat and relax.
Example: I need to print a few pages for an appointment. Can anyone help?
Example: Looking for a winter coat
Example: I\'m looking for a warm coat in size M for this winter.
Example: I\'m looking for a sleeping bag to sleep outside this winter. If anyone has one to give, it would be a great help.
Example: I\'m looking for soap or shower gel. If anyone has extras, I\'d gladly take them.
Example: I\'m looking for someone to share a coffee with this week in the neighborhood.
Example: I offer to do laundry for someone who might need it.
Example: Sports shoes to give away
Example: I\'m giving away a pair of sports shoes in good condition, size 42.
Example: Mobile phone to give away
Example: I\'m giving away an old but functional mobile phone. Perfect for someone in need.
Example: Hygiene products to give away
Example: I\'m giving away several packs of hygiene products.
